questions.question_html: Carbon- 14 is present in all living organisms and decays at a predictable rate. To estimate the age of an organism, archaeologists measure the amount of carbon- 14 left in its remains. The approximate amount of carbon-14 remaining after 5000 years can be found using the formula \displaystyle A=A_{0}(2.7)^{-\frac{3}{5}} , where \displaystyle A_{0} is the initial amount of carbon-14 in the sample that is tested. How much carbon- 14 is left in a sample that is 5000 years old and originally contained \displaystyle 7.0 \times 10^{-12} grams of carbon- \displaystyle 14 ?

questions.question_html: Inflation The formula \displaystyle C=c(1+r)^{n} can be used to estimate the future cost \displaystyle C of an item due to inflation. Here \displaystyle c represents the current cost of the item, \displaystyle r is the rate of inflation, and \displaystyle n is the number of years for the projection. Suppose a video game system costs \displaystyle \$ 299 now. How much will the price increase in nine months with an annual inflation rate of \displaystyle 3.2 \% ?

questions.question_html:
The number of cells in a cell culture grows exponentially. The number of cells in the culture as a function of time is given by the expression \displaystyle N\left(\frac{6}{5}\right)^{t} , where \displaystyle t is measured in hours and \displaystyle N is the initial size of the culture.

a. After 2 hours, there were 144 cells in the culture. What was \displaystyle N ?

b. How many cells were in the culture after 20 minutes?

c. How many cells were in the culture after \displaystyle 2.5 hours?
